points: Designed and prototyped intuitive UIs in Figma, then implemented them in both WPF and Flutter for a seamless user experience
Developed and maintained cross‑platform applications on Windows desktop and Android, ensuring consistent functionality and performance
Built custom C++ algorithms for robotic path planning—segmenting trajectories, path interpellation, and dynamically modifying waypoints
Integrated RoboDK simulations for Robots directly into the desktop application to validate motion plans
Captured and processed Zivid 3D point‑cloud data, using HALCON image‑processing code to align scans with CAD models and automatically place robot paths
Created native Android plugins (Java) for SMB network‑share access and implemented GPS NTRIP/NMEA receivers for real‑time location streaming
Developed an AR application in Unity to simulate modelled system integrations for industrial companies

entries.label: Bachelor of Games and Interactive Design

points: Developed games for different platforms in different group assignments and publication to stores
Advanced game design and development theories
Won a 24hr game design challenge for best overall complete game state

entries.label: Diploma of Digital and Interactive Games

points: Introduction to developing games through the use of Unity
Designed 3D assets through Autodesk 3ds Max and Autodesk Maya
Introduction to agile project management and software design documentation (GDD and TDD)
